item.title: Paraglider killed on Mt Maunganui 'died doing what he loved' - Waikato Times
item.description:
Paraglider killed on Mt Maunganui 'died doing what he loved'  Waikato Times

A man killed in a paragliding crash on Mount Maunganui in Tauranga lived locally and died doing what he loved, a man who knew him says. Senior Sergeant ...

item.title: Paraglider crash on Mt Maunganui - Newshub
item.description:
Paraglider crash on Mt Maunganui  Newshub

A paraglider has died after a crash near the summit of Mt Maunganui. Emergency services were alerted to the crash at 6.20pm this evening and an emergency ...

View full coverage on Google News

item.title: Horrifying VIDEO: Man hangs on to glider at over 1,000 meters after pilot fails to attach harness - RT
item.description:
Horrifying VIDEO: Man hangs on to glider at over 1,000 meters after pilot fails to attach harness  RT

A jaw-dropping video of a Florida tourist hanging on for dear life over Swiss mountains during his maiden hang-gliding flight has gone viral on YouTube. Chris Gursky decided to try something new while vacationing with his wife in Interlaken, Switzerland in October. Eager to experience the adrenaline rush and breathtaking views of the Swiss countryside, the man from Florida decided try hang gliding. His experience turned into a complete nightmare but made him a YouTube sensation overnight. The tandem flight went wrong from the start when the instructor failed to strap Gursky in and then set ...

item.title: British paraglider dies during "acrobatic" flight in Swiss Alps - The Telegraph
item.description:
British paraglider dies during "acrobatic" flight in Swiss Alps  The Telegraph

A British paraglider has died after embarking on a solo flight in the Swiss Alps on Thursday afternoon. Adam Macpherson, 36, from South Yorkshire, had a tragic accident around 2.30pm on Thursday in Stechelberg, Lauterbrunnen. Adam, who lived in Bern, took off from the village of Mürren before he got into difficulties and crashed onto a main road, according to the police. Despite the resuscitation and rescue efforts from passers-by, Adam succumbed to his injuries at the scene of the accident on Thursday. Having grown up in Kiveton Park, South Yorkshire, Adam spent his weekends exploring and...

item.title: Video shows holiday hang glider flight going horribly wrong - CNN
item.description:
Video shows holiday hang glider flight going horribly wrong  CNN

Other people's vacation videos can be painfully dull. Chris Gursky's is painfully terrifying -- best watched while peeking through your fingers. Gursky, an American, was on his first day of a vacation in Switzerland when he decided to take a tandem hang gliding ride over the Alpine scenery. Unfortunately, he says, the hang gliding instructor failed to attach his safety harness. As soon as the hang glider left the ground, Gursky was left clinging on with his bare hands, desperately trying not to fall as the ground dropped away beneath them. What follows is some of the scariest moments ever c...

item.title: First-Time Hang Glider Hangs On For Dear Life Without Safety Harness - HuffPost
item.description:
First-Time Hang Glider Hangs On For Dear Life Without Safety Harness  HuffPost

Chris Gursky called it an “unexpected twist.” We call it FREAKIN’ TERRIFYING. The Florida man posted video Monday of his harrowing first hang-gliding flight after the instructor forgot to attach his safety harness. An airborne Gursky can be seen grabbing what he can to hold on for survival as the tandem pilot frantically searches for a safe place to land over mountainous terrain in Switzerland. Gursky mined his near-tragedy for a few laughs in the YouTube captions. “Thinking nice view ... I’m gonna die!” one read as he struggled to maintain his grip. Gursky said he had to hang on for his li...

item.title: Watch hang glider hold on for dear life - CNN
item.description:
Watch hang glider hold on for dear life  CNN

After realizing he was not strapped in while hang gliding in Switzerland, American Chris Gursky held on for nearly four minutes while the pilot navigated to a safe landing. ©2018 Cable News Network, Inc. A WarnerMedia Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Man hangs on for dear life after realising harness not attached to hang glider - ABC News
item.description:
Man hangs on for dear life after realising harness not attached to hang glider  ABC News

A US man says he experienced an "unexpected twist" when he decided to try hang gliding on holiday in Switzerland — and discovered his instructor had failed to secure his harness. Key points: - Mr Gursky said pilot failed to secure his harness before take-off - Incident took place on Mr Gursky's first day on holiday in Switzerland - Said he fractured wrist in landing Florida resident Chris Gursky shared anxiety-inducing footage of the incident. The clip depicts Mr Gursky as he was forced to spend minutes desperately clinging to the glider while the pilot controlling it tried to find a safe p...

item.title: Hang glider desperately clings on after pilot forgets to attach him, in terrifying video - The Independent
item.description:
Hang glider desperately clings on after pilot forgets to attach him, in terrifying video  The Independent

A first-time hang glider had to desperately cling on after his instructor forgot to attach him to the craft. Incredible footage has shows Chris Gurksy, who is from Florida, experiencing hang gliding for the first time while on holiday in Switzerland, Seconds after taking off with an instructor, Mr Gursky can be seen realising his not strapped in properly before gripping tightly onto the bar of the hang glider to stay alive. Read more - Hanging around: With the advent of motorised launches, the unique - Sporting Digest: Hang Gliding - Country: Weekend Walk- Fom King John's pond to hang-glide...

item.title: Hang glider on first solo flight with kit bought on eBay gets stuck 80ft up a tree - The Telegraph
item.description:
Hang glider on first solo flight with kit bought on eBay gets stuck 80ft up a tree  The Telegraph

A trainee hang glider pilot on his first solo flight was rescued from a tree after getting stuck 80 feet up on the South Downs. The learner told rescuers he bought his glider on eBay, and was minutes into his first solo flight when he veered into trees near the village of Fulking in West Sussex. The man became wedged in a treeCredit: Eddie Mitchell The Technical Rescue Unit of West Sussex Fire and Rescue got the man down after being wedged in the tree for more than two hours. The specially trained firefighters used harnesses and climbing gear to bring the man down safely. The Kent Sussex a...

item.title: Outback paraglider who flies with eagles - ABC News
item.description:
Outback paraglider who flies with eagles  ABC News

Is it a bird, is it a plane? No, it's Damian Gribble the Outback paraglider. Mr Gribble is a common sight above the skies of Mount Isa, where he works as a safety officer in the mining industry. Soaring high above the western Queensland city, Mr Gribble has had several close encounters with curious wedge-tailed eagles who come up close for a look. External Link: Paragliding video "I've had numerous flights where you're flying along and next minute you've got a big wedgie flying next to you, just checking you out," he said. "And as long as it's not nesting season they tend to leave you alone...

Paragliders jumps from hilss to the lap of few lake in Pokhara western Nepal.

item.title: Swiss to investigate near-miss hang gliding incident - The Associated Press
item.description:
Swiss to investigate near-miss hang gliding incident  The Associated Press

GENEVA (AP) — Switzerland's civil aviation authority said it will question a hang-glider pilot after a tourist he flew over a picturesque Swiss landscape nearly fell dozens of meters (yards) to the ground because his harness wasn't properly attached. A nail-biting video of the incident drew more than 1.4 million views on YouTube by Tuesday, a day after it was posted. The video edit titled "Swiss Mishap" starts with a written introduction and then zooms in on the two men, with a note that the passenger's harness isn't attached. After a countdown and running to a takeoff, the passenger dangle...

item.title: Flight of imagination: human swan completes 7,000 mile journey to save the Bewick's - The Telegraph
item.description:
Flight of imagination: human swan completes 7,000 mile journey to save the Bewick's  The Telegraph

I caught sight of the White Cliffs of Dover on November 29, from the skies above Calais. It was the first moment during my three-month paramotor journey, following Bewick’s swans as they migrated from Russia’s Arctic tundra to Britain, that I’d had time to think about coming home. When you’re high enough in the sky the air is amazingly clear, and I saw the cliffs as a big smile in the distance. Like the swans, my epic 7,000-mile migration was nearly complete: Slimbridge Wetland Centre in Gloucestershire, our final destination, was just a few days flight away. I burst into tears. Adventure h...

item.title: Paragliding above the tropical blue surf - 500px
item.description:

Photo taken from Makapu'u beach park, in East Oahu, near Waimanalo, Hawaii - see cloud and paraglider reflections in the tide pools

item.title: Paragliding: Hungarian Thomas Antalffy's 'life changing' near-death experience - CNN
item.description:
Paragliding: Hungarian Thomas Antalffy's 'life changing' near-death experience  CNN

The last thing Thomas Antalffy remembers is slowly circling towards the ground in the late afternoon at the end of a terrific three-hour paragliding flight in central Brazil. He woke up the next morning covered in blood "in the middle of the bush." "I remember one shoulder hurting, but other than that I didn't feel any pain. I even took a selfie," Antalffy tells CNN. After all, he had been paragliding off and on for a couple of decades; this was just another adventure. So he packed up his parachute and lugged the 20-kilogram bag to the highway, where he flagged someone down and got a ride b...

item.title: 'Human swan' describes navigating thunderstorms and battling temperatures of -25C during 4,500-mile trip - The Telegraph
item.description:
'Human swan' describes navigating thunderstorms and battling temperatures of -25C during 4,500-mile trip  The Telegraph

She’s flown 4,500 miles, navigated the desolate expanse of the Russian arctic, endured a dislocated kneecap and become the first woman ever to cross the English channel in a motorised paraglider. But 41-year-old conservationist Sara Dench said the most frightening part of her journey as a “human swan” was enduring temperatures of -25C and flying through snow and thunderstorms. She’s done it! Sacha has become the 1st woman to cross the Channel by #paramotor. Welcome home #FlightOfTheSwans! pic.twitter.com/9EIMY1Ynmo — WWT (@WWTworldwide) December 5, 2016 “At one point I just collapsed in tea...

item.title: Briton killed in New Zealand paraglider accident - The Guardian
item.description:
Briton killed in New Zealand paraglider accident  The Guardian

A British expat has died in a paraglider accident in New Zealand. Ben Letham, 26, was on a solo flight when he came down in the grounds of Queenstown primary school after taking off from the South Island town’s Skyline gondola. Gavin Taylor, the co-director of GForce Paragliding, said Letham, originally from Lochgilphead in Argyll, had been flying for around six years and was a full-time pilot with the company. Taylor said conditions at the time of the incident had been calm and he did not know what had gone wrong. “Ben would have done thousands of flights at this site, both commercially an...

item.title: Paragliding marathon with the world's best - CNN
item.description:
Paragliding marathon with the world's best  CNN

Once a year, the top paragliding pilots in the country gather for a grueling, gravity-defying, seven-day marathon called the Rat Race. Powered only by the wind and sun, pilots must navigate a different course each day as they soar thousands of feet over the Oregon countryside. The fastest to the finish line wins. This year, the Rat Race—named for its launch-point at Woodrat Mountain—hosted the U.S. National Paragliding Championships. One of the top American pilots, Nick Greece, takes us into the "gaggle" to experience what its like to soar with the wind. ©2017 Cable News Network, Inc. A Tim...

item.title: Singaporean paraglider who saved Palu quake victims dies in India - CNN
item.description:
Singaporean paraglider who saved Palu quake victims dies in India  CNN

A Singaporean paraglider who helped rescue trapped people in last month's earthquake in Indonesia has died while paragliding in India, according to a memorial posted by the Air Sports Federation of Singapore (AFS). Ng Kok Choong, who was in Palu during the earthquake and subsequent tsunami, went missing Monday in Himachal Pradesh province after the weather turned while he was airborne, according to a statement from the AFS. His body was found by an Indian helicopter search team Tuesday, the statement said. "(Ng) was selfless, brave and always moving for the next challenge," it added. "As re...

item.title: How a water skiing stunt in 1963 made aviation history - ABC News
item.description:
How a water skiing stunt in 1963 made aviation history  ABC News

Fifty-five years after the first flight of a hang-glider in a water skiing stunt on the Clarence River at Grafton in New South Wales, the boat driver Pat Crowe has been awarded the 2018 Hang Gliding Diploma by the Federation Aeronautique Internationale. It's the culmination of 12 years of research by hang-glider pilot Graeme Henderson. Mr Henderson was determined to prove that the very first flight of the modern delta wing hang-glider happened at Grafton. The mission began when he saw a photograph of John Dickenson testing a half-size model of his new design for a kite. "He wanted to build ...

item.title: British and Ukrainian paragliders die after colliding in midair - The Guardian
item.description:
British and Ukrainian paragliders die after colliding in midair  The Guardian

A respected British paraglider has died after colliding in midair with another pilot during a competition in Macedonia. Innes Powell, 54, and Igor Volov, a 56-year-old Ukrainian, collided before the final race of the British Open in Kruševo on Friday. Both men were fatally injured after falling to the ground after the collision, which happened at around midday. Volov was declared dead at the scene while Powell died in a nearby hospital following resuscitation attempts, Macedonian police said. Tributes were paid to the British pilot by the Isle of Wight Hang Gliding and Paragliding Club (IOW...

item.title: Tributes paid to 'hero' UK paraglider who died after midair collision - The Guardian
item.description:
Tributes paid to 'hero' UK paraglider who died after midair collision  The Guardian

Tributes have been paid to a respected British paraglider who died after colliding midair with another pilot during a competition in Macedonia. Innes Powell, 54, died on Friday after he reportedly swung into Igor Volov, a 56-year-old Ukrainian, before the final race of the British Open in Kruševo, fatally injuring both men. Powell was an experienced pilot and was hailed as a hero for risking his life to save another paraglider when she crashed into a cliff ledge, a rescue that was retold in the 2008 Discovery Channel series True Heroes. Condolences have poured in from across the British par...

item.title: Innes Powell: British paraglider, 54, dies after crashing with another pilot in mid-air - The Independent
item.description:
Innes Powell: British paraglider, 54, dies after crashing with another pilot in mid-air  The Independent

A British paraglider has died after crashing into another pilot in mid-air during a competition in Macedonia. Innes Powell, 54, collided with Ukranian Igor Volov, 56, shortly before the final race of the British Open in Krusevo. He was unable to open his reserve parachute and plunged on to a path below. Mr Powell, a well known instructor, was declared dead after being taken to a nearby hospital, Macedonian police said. The Ukranian pilot, who was not a competitor, managed to open his parachute but died at the scene after landing in a tree, according to witnesses. Read more - Man charged ove...

item.title: Protester paraglides over Trump, gets away - CNN
item.description:
Protester paraglides over Trump, gets away  CNN

A paragliding protester hovered within surprising proximity of President Donald Trump on Friday night as the president admired the view from Trump Turnberry, his golf resort in Scotland. As he floated by, the Greenpeace activist held a banner that read "TRUMP, WELL BELOW PAR #RESIST." Greenpeace tweeted an image with the caption, "We've just delivered a message to @RealDonaldTrump as he was standing outside his hotel in Turnberry watching. #Resist #StopTrump." Police Scotland's assistant chief constable, Mark Williams, revealed that the paraglider managed to escape after the incident. "We a...

item.title: Trump arrives to meet Putin, leaving the UK reeling in his wake - The Guardian
item.description:
Trump arrives to meet Putin, leaving the UK reeling in his wake  The Guardian

Donald Trump arrived in Finland on Sunday after a UK visit which saw him tramp mud through his red-carpet welcome and leave diplomatic protocol a little tattered in his wake. After teeing off in Scottish drizzle for a final round at his Turnberry golf course, the US president boarded Air Force One bound for Helsinki and a summit with the Russian president, Vladimir Putin. Related: 'Not welcome': Finnish protesters criticise Trump-Putin summit As he reflected on his trip, an undoubted highlight had been tea with the Queen, Trump told ITV’s Good Morning Britain host Piers Morgan. She was a “f...

item.title: Welcome to Bir, paragliding capital of India - CNN
item.description:
Welcome to Bir, paragliding capital of India  CNN

Hidden in the foothills of the Indian Himalayas, the largely agricultural village of Bir is better known to visitors by its nickname -- the "paragliding capital of India." Located in the state of Himachal Pradesh in northern India, this small village has witnessed a boom in popularity among international paragliders after it hosted the Paragliding World Cup in 2015. "Paragliding has made this village famous. Otherwise, very few people knew about it," says Arvind Paul, a paragliding instructor. "The local community has benefited a lot from it. 100% of the locals are farmers, but this is a go...

item.title: Paramotor pilots brave the elements, gliding 1600km from Lake Eyre to Mt Kosciuszko - ABC News
item.description:
Paramotor pilots brave the elements, gliding 1600km from Lake Eyre to Mt Kosciuszko  ABC News

By Camron Slessor Imagine flying through the air, exposed to the harsh Australian elements for 1600 kilometres, from the country's lowest point to its highest point. And you're doing it with a two-stroke engine on your back. That is the feat achieved by one group of daredevil Australians, who have soared from Lake Eyre to the highest point of the snow-capped crest of Mt Kosciuszko. The paramotor pilots, aged between 23 and 62, are members of the Hang Gliding Federation of Australia (HGFA) and completed the Australian-first journey over a two-week period last fortnight. It was the longest pa...

item.title: Paragliding instructor died after encountering turbulence, inquest hears - The Telegraph
item.description:
Paragliding instructor died after encountering turbulence, inquest hears  The Telegraph

A paragliding instructor plunged to his death after encountering turbulence during a test flight, an inquest has heard. Paul Kilburn, 54, had gone up his machine ahead of escorting a group on a training exercise, but his equipment suddenly became caught in a spin, and he crashed into a field. Mr Kilburn, from Flixton, Greater Manchester was rushed to hospital, but could not be saved, as he suffered multiple injuries. An inquiry blamed the accident on the businessman encountering turbulence as he flew above trees and nearby housing, during the accident at 1pm on December 3 last year. He ran ...

item.title: Paraglider killed in 'mid-air microlight collision' - The Telegraph
item.description:
Paraglider killed in 'mid-air microlight collision'  The Telegraph

A paraglider was killed and another seriously injured following a suspected mid-air microlight collision. Police were called to the scene in the village of Northborough, near Peterborough, early this morning. Pictures showed fragments of the microlights scattered across a field as officers combed the site for evidence. One of the paragliders was airlifted to hospital in Nottingham with potentially life-changing injuries. No details of the victims’ identities have been released. One person was killed in the suspected microlight collisionCredit: Terry Harris A Cambridgeshire police spokesman ...

item.title: One paraglider dies and another suffers serious injuries following mid-air collision - The Independent
item.description:
One paraglider dies and another suffers serious injuries following mid-air collision  The Independent

One paraglider pilot died and another suffered serious injuries following a mid-air collision. Emergency services rushed to scene in Northborough, eight miles north of Peterborough, at 8.45am on bank holiday Monday. A man in his 50s, believed to be from Lincolnshire, was found dead at the scene while the second paraglider, in his 40s, was airlifted to hospital with severe, potentially life-changing, injuries. Read more - Paraglider rescued after crashing into Cornwall cliff face - Catching a drift paragliding over Colombia's 'beautiful city' - Colombia: South America's paragliding hotspot T...

item.title: Rising steadily — Australia's paragliders making it on the world stage - ABC News
item.description:
Rising steadily — Australia's paragliders making it on the world stage  ABC News

In a picturesque pocket of north-east Victoria, hundreds of people travel from across the world throughout the year to line the ridge of a steep alpine slope known as Mystic Hill and throw themselves off the side. They are paragliding pilots — some of them world champions — and they have began making the journey to the southern hemisphere to explore the strong thermals, foreign scenery, and stiff competition on offer in Australia. This year, the township of Bright helped put Australian paragliding on the global stage as part of the 2018 Paragliding World Cup. It's mostly smooth sailing for ...

Paragliding in northern India  CNN

Himachal Pradesh has become a popular destination for paragliding. We take to the sky with 16-year-old female paraglider Aditi Thakur. ©2017 Cable News Network, Inc. A Time Warner Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Paraglider dead after slamming into cliff - ABC News
item.description:
Paraglider dead after slamming into cliff  ABC News

A popular Newcastle cliff top is a crime scene after a paraglider died when he slammed into a rock face. Police said up to a dozen witnesses saw the paraglider crash into the cliff at Shepherds Hill that sits on the Newcastle coastline. They said the man, believed to be in his 60s, took off from a popular lookout and was in the air for about 10 minutes before tragedy struck. Newcastle police inspector Gerard Lawson said the man was dragged up to the top of the cliff by onlookers, but could not be revived. Inspector Lawson said the man was passionate about paragliding. "He was here doing som...

item.title: North Korean special forces use paragliders in simulated attack on South Korean-US military HQ - The Telegraph
item.description:
North Korean special forces use paragliders in simulated attack on South Korean-US military HQ  The Telegraph

North Korean special forces have carried out an exercise in which they used paragliders to simulate infiltrating behind South Korean lines and launch an attack on the headquarters of the joint South Korean-US military command. Officials of Seoul's Defence Ministry told Yonhap news that the exercises were conducted over a number of days in mid-September and were the first time that the tactic had been tested by the North. Special forces troops used paragliders to land on a training ground where a mock-up of the South Korea-US Combined Forces Command in Seoul had been constructed. The new inf...
